Welcome, " + operatorName + "!");\n            return true;\n        }\n        this.isLoggedIn = false;\n        System.out.println("Login failed. Invalid credentials.");\n        return false;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Logs out the agency operator.\n     */\n    public void logout() {\n        this.isLoggedIn = false;\n        System.out.println("Logged out successfully.");\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Checks if operator is logged in.\n     * @return true if logged in, false otherwise\n     */\n    public boolean isLoggedIn() {\n        return isLoggedIn;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Sets the list of available rest points (from SearchRefreshmentPoint use case).\n     * @param restPoints List of rest points\n     */\n    public void setAvailableRestPoints(List<RestPoint> restPoints) {\n        if (restPoints != null) {\n            this.availableRestPoints = new ArrayList<>(restPoints);\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Displays the list of available rest points.\n     */\n    public void displayRestPoints() {\n        if (availableRestPoints.isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("No rest points available.");\n            return;\n        }\n        \n        System.out.println("\\n=== Available Rest Points ===");\n        for (int i = 0; i < availableRestPoints.size(); i++) {\n            RestPoint point = availableRestPoints.get(i);\n            System.out.println((i + 1) + ". " + point.getPointName() + \n                             " (ID: " + point.getPointId() + \n                             ", Location: " + point.getLocation() + \n                             ", Banners: " + point.getBannerCount() + ")");\n        }\n        System.out.println("=============================\\n");\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Main method to execute the banner modification flow.\n     * This implements the complete use case flow.\n     */\n    public void executeModifyBannerFlow() {\n        if (!isLoggedIn) {\n            System.out.println("Error: Operator must be logged in to modify banners.");\n            return;\n        }\n        \n        try {\n            // Step 1: Receive list of rest points and select one\n            System.out.println("\\n=== Step 1: Select a Rest Point ===");\n            displayRestPoints();\n            \n            if (availableRestPoints.isEmpty()) {\n                System.out.println("No rest points available. Exiting flow.");\n                return;\n            }\n            \n            System.out.print("Enter the number of the rest point to select: ");\n            int pointChoice = Integer.parseInt(scanner.nextLine()) - 1;\n            \n            if (pointChoice < 0 || pointChoice >= availableRestPoints.size()) {\n                System.out.println("Invalid selection. Exiting flow.");\n                return;\n            }\n            \n            RestPoint selectedPoint = availableRestPoints.get(pointChoice);\n            System.out.println("Selected: " + selectedPoint.getPointName());\n            \n            // Step 2: View list of banners associated with the selected rest point\n            System.out.println("\\n=== Step 2: Banners at Selected Rest Point ===");\n            List<Banner> banners = selectedPoint.getBanners();\n            \n            if (banners.isEmpty()) {\n                System.out.println("No banners available at this rest point. Exiting flow.");\n                return;\n            }\n            \n            for (int i = 0; i < banners.size(); i++) {\n                Banner banner = banners.get(i);\n                System.out.println((i + 1) + ". Banner ID: " + banner.getBannerId() + \n                                 ", Image: " + banner.getImagePath() + \n                                 ", Status: " + (banner.validateImage() ? "Valid" : "Invalid"));\n            }\n            \n            // Step 3: Select a banner from the list\n            System.out.println("\\n=== Step 3: Select a Banner to Edit ===");\n            System.out.print("Enter the number of the banner to edit: ");\n            int bannerChoice = Integer.parseInt(scanner.nextLine()) - 1;\n            \n            if (bannerChoice < 0 || bannerChoice >= banners.size()) {\n                System.out.println("Invalid banner selection. Exiting flow.");\n                return;\n            }\n            \n            Banner selectedBanner = banners.get(bannerChoice);\n            System.out.println("Selected Banner: " + selectedBanner.getBannerId());\n            \n            // Step 4: Display form for image selection\n            System.out.println("\\n=== Step 4: Image Selection Form ===");\n            System.out.println("Current image: " + selectedBanner.getImagePath());\n            System.out.print("Enter the path to the new image file: ");\n            String newImagePath = scanner.nextLine().trim();\n            \n            // Step 5: Send request to change the system\n            System.out.println("\\n=== Step 5: Processing Image Change Request ===");\n            \n            // Step 6: Check characteristics of the inserted image\n            System.out.println("\\n=== Step 6: Image Validation ===");\n            boolean isValid = validateImageForBanner(newImagePath);\n            \n            if (!isValid) {\n                System.out.println("ERROR: The inserted image is not valid.");\n                System.out.println("Enabling use case Errored...");\n                handleErrorCase(selectedBanner, newImagePath);\n                return;\n            }\n            \n            // Ask for confirmation\n            System.out.println("\\nImage validation successful!");\n            System.out.println("New image path: " + newImagePath);\n            System.out.print("Confirm banner change? (yes/no): ");\n            String confirmation = scanner.nextLine().trim().toLowerCase();\n            \n            // Step 7: Confirmation of transaction change\n            if (confirmation.equals("yes") || confirmation.equals("y")) {\n                System.out.println("\\n=== Step 7: Confirming Transaction ===");\n                \n                // Step 8: Bookmark the new image for the selected banner\n                System.out.println("\\n=== Step 8: Updating Banner Image ===");\n                boolean updateSuccess = selectedBanner.updateImage(newImagePath);\n                \n                if (updateSuccess) {\n                    System.out.println("SUCCESS: Banner image has been updated successfully!");\n                    System.out.println("Banner ID: " + selectedBanner.getBannerId());\n                    System.out.println("New Image: " + selectedBanner.getImagePath());\n                    System.out.println("Updated at: " + selectedBanner.getUpdatedAt());\n                    \n                    // Exit condition: Notify successful modification\n                    System.out.println("\\n=== Exit Condition: Successful Modification ===");\n                    System.out.println("The system has successfully modified the banner.");\n                } else {\n                    System.out.println("ERROR: Failed to update banner image.");\n                    handleErrorCase(selectedBanner, newImagePath);\n                }\n            } else {\n                System.out.println("Transaction cancelled by user.");\n            }\n            \n        } catch (NumberFormatException e) {\n            System.out.println("Invalid input. Please enter a valid number.");\n        } catch (Exception e) {\n            System.out.println("An unexpected error occurred: " + e.getMessage());\n            handleServerInterruption();\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Validates an image file for banner use.\n     * @param imagePath Path to the image file\n     * @return true if image is valid, false otherwise\n     */\n    private boolean validateImageForBanner(String imagePath) {\n        if (imagePath == null || imagePath.trim().isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("Error: Image path cannot be empty.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        File imageFile = new File(imagePath);\n        \n        // Check if file exists\n        if (!imageFile.exists()) {\n            System.out.println("Error: Image file does not exist: " + imagePath);\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Check if file is readable\n        if (!imageFile.canRead()) {\n            System.out.println("Error: Cannot read image file: " + imagePath);\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Check file size (max 5MB for banner images)\n        long fileSize = imageFile.length();\n        long maxSize = 5 * 1024 * 1024; // 5MB\n        if (fileSize > maxSize) {\n            System.out.println("Error: Image file is too large. Maximum size is 5MB.");\n            System.out.println("Current size: " + (fileSize / 1024) + "KB");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Check file extension\n        String fileName = imageFile.getName().toLowerCase();\n        String[] validExtensions = {".jpg", ".jpeg", ".png", ".gif", ".bmp"};\n        \n        for (String ext : validExtensions) {\n            if (fileName.endsWith(ext)) {\n                System.out.println("Image validation passed: " + fileName);\n                System.out.println("File size: " + (fileSize / 1024) + "KB");\n                return true;\n            }\n        }\n        \n        System.out.println("Error: Invalid image format. Supported formats: JPG, JPEG, PNG, GIF, BMP");\n        return false;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Handles error case when image validation fails.\n     * @param banner The banner being modified\n     * @param invalidImagePath The invalid image path\n     */\n    private void handleErrorCase(Banner banner, String invalidImagePath) {\n        System.out.println("\\n=== Error Case Handler ===");\n        System.out.println("Banner ID: " + banner.getBannerId());\n        System.out.println("Invalid image path: " + invalidImagePath);\n        System.out.println("Current image preserved: " + banner.getImagePath());\n        System.out.println("Please try again with a valid image file.");\n        \n        // Log the error for monitoring\n        logError("Image validation failed for banner " + banner.getBannerId() + \n                ", invalid path: " + invalidImagePath);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Handles server interruption (ETOUR connection loss).\n     */\n    private void handleServerInterruption() {\n        System.out.println("\\n=== Server Interruption Handler ===");\n        System.out.println("ERROR: Connection to server ETOUR has been interrupted.");\n        System.out.println("Please check your network connection and try again.");\n        System.out.println("Any pending transactions may need to be restarted.");\n        \n        // Log the interruption\n        logError("Server ETOUR connection interrupted at " + new Date());\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Logs error messages to a file.\n     * @param errorMessage The error message to log\n     */\n    private void logError(String errorMessage) {\n        try (PrintWriter writer = new PrintWriter(new FileWriter("banner_errors.log", true))) {\n            writer.println(new Date() + " - " + errorMessage);\n        } catch (IOException e) {\n            System.err.println("Failed to write to error log: " + e.getMessage());\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Gets the operator ID.\n     * @return operator ID\n     */\n    public String getOperatorId() {\n        return operatorId;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Gets the operator name.\n     * @return operator name\n     */\n    public String getOperatorName() {\n        return operatorName;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Gets the list of available rest points.\n     * @return list of rest points\n     */\n    public List<RestPoint> getAvailableRestPoints() {\n        return Collections.unmodifiableList(availableRestPoints);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Adds a rest point to available list.\n     * @param restPoint Rest point to add\n     */\n    public void addRestPoint(RestPoint restPoint) {\n        if (restPoint != null) {\n            availableRestPoints.add(restPoint);\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Removes a rest point from available list.\n     * @param pointId ID of the rest point to remove\n     * @return true if removed, false if not found\n     */\n    public boolean removeRestPoint(String pointId) {\n        return availableRestPoints.removeIf(point -> point.getPointId().equals(pointId));\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Clears the scanner resource.\n     * Should be called when the operator is no longer needed.\n     */\n    public void close() {\n        if (scanner != null) {\n            scanner.close();\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Simulates a test run of the modify banner flow with sample data.\n     * This is for demonstration purposes.\n     */\n    public void testModifyBannerFlow() {\n        System.out.println("\\n=== Starting Test testPoint.addBanner(testBanner2);\n        \n        List<RestPoint> testPoints = new ArrayList<>();\n        testPoints.add(testPoint);\n        \n        setAvailableRestPoints(testPoints);\n /home///baselines/MetaGPT/workspace/ModifyBannerJava_1766826453/ImageValidator.java has been successfully created, with content:\nimport java.io.File;\nimport java.io.IOException;\nimport java.nio.file.Files;\nimport java.nio.file.Path;\nimport java.nio.file.Paths;\nimport java.util.Arrays;\nimport java.util.HashSet;\nimport java.util.Set;\n\n/**\n * A comprehensive image validator for banner advertisement images.\n * This class performs various checks to ensure image files meet the required standards.\n */\npublic class ImageValidator {\n    \n    // Supported image formats\n    private static final Set<String> SUPPORTED_FORMATS = new HashSet<>(Arrays.asList(\n        ".jpg", ".jpeg", ".png", ".gif", ".bmp"\n    ));\n    \n    // Maximum file size for banner images (5MB)\n    private static final long MAX_FILE_SIZE = 5 * 1024 * 1024;\n    \n    // Minimum dimensions for banner images\n    private static final int MIN_WIDTH = 300;\n    private static final int MIN_HEIGHT = 150;\n    \n    // Maximum dimensions for banner images\n    private static final int MAX_WIDTH = 1920;\n    private static final int MAX_HEIGHT = 1080;\n    \n    /**\n     * Validates an image file for use as a banner.\n     * Performs comprehensive checks including format, size, and basic file validation.\n     * \n     * @param imagePath Path to the image file\n     * @return ValidationResult object containing validation status and messages\n     */\n    public ValidationResult validateImage(String imagePath) {\n        ValidationResult result = new ValidationResult();\n        \n        if (imagePath == null || imagePath.trim().isEmpty()) {\n            result.addError("Image path cannot be null or empty");\n            return result;\n        }\n        \n        File imageFile = new File(imagePath);\n        \n        // Check file existence and accessibility\n        if (!imageFile.exists()) {\n            result.addError("Image file does not exist: " + imagePath);\n            return result;\n        }\n        \n        if (!imageFile.canRead()) {\n            result.addError("Cannot read image file. Check file permissions: " + imagePath);\n            return result;\n        }\n        \n        if (!imageFile.isFile()) {\n            result.addError("Path is not a file: " + imagePath);\n            return result;\n        }\n        \n        // Check file size\n        long fileSize = imageFile.length();\n        if (fileSize == 0) {\n            result.addError("Image file is empty (0 bytes)");\n            return result;\n        }\n        \n        if (fileSize > MAX_FILE_SIZE) {\n            result.addError("Image file is too large. Maximum size: " + \n                          (MAX_FILE_SIZE / (1024 * 1024)) + "MB. " +\n                          "Current size: " + String.format("%.2f", fileSize / (1024.0 * 1024.0)) + "MB");\n            return result;\n        }\n        \n        // Check file extension\n        String fileName = imageFile.getName().toLowerCase();\n        boolean validExtension = false;\n        String fileExtension = "";\n        \n        for (String format : SUPPORTED_FORMATS) {\n            if (fileName.endsWith(format)) {\n                validExtension = true;\n                fileExtension = format;\n                break;\n            }\n        }\n        \n        if (!validExtension) {\n            result.addError("Unsupported image format. Supported formats: " + \n                          String.join(", ", SUPPORTED_FORMATS));\n            return result;\n        }\n        \n        // Check file header/magic numbers for basic format validation\n        if (!validateFileSignature(imageFile, fileExtension)) {\n            result.addError("File signature does not match the expected format for " + fileExtension);\n            return result;\n        }\n        \n        // Check image dimensions if possible\n        try {\n            // Note: In a real implementation, you would use an image library like ImageIO\n            // to read dimensions. For this example, we\'ll simulate it.\n            // String dimensions = getImageDimensions(imageFile);\n            // result.setDimensions(dimensions);\n            \n            // For demonstration, we\'ll add a success message about dimensions\n            result.addInfo("Image dimensions check would be performed here with an image library");\n        } catch (Exception e) {\n            result.addWarning("Could not read image dimensions: " + e.getMessage());\n        }\n        \n        // All checks passed\n        result.setValid(true);\n        result.addInfo("Image validation successful");\n        result.addInfo("File: " + fileName);\n        result.addInfo("Size: " + String.format("%.2f", fileSize / 1024.0) + "KB");\n        result.addInfo("Format: " + fileExtension.substring(1).toUpperCase());\n        \n        return result;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Validates file signature (magic numbers) to ensure file format matches its extension.\n     * \n     * @param file The image file to validate\n     * @param extension The expected file extension\n     * @return true if file signature matches the extension, false otherwise\n     */\n    private boolean validateFileSignature(File file, String extension) {\n        try {\n            byte[] header = new byte[8];\n            Path path = Paths.get(file.getAbsolutePath());\n            byte[] fileBytes = Files.readAllBytes(path);\n            \n            if (fileBytes.length < 8) {\n                return false;\n            }\n            \n            System.arraycopy(fileBytes, 0, header, 0, 8);\n            \n            // Check for common image file signatures\n            switch (extension) {\n                case ".jpg":\n                case ".jpeg":\n                    // JPEG files start with FF D8 FF\n                    return (header[0] == (byte)0xFF && header[1] == (byte)0xD8 && \n                            header[2] == (byte)0xFF);\n                    \n                case ".png":\n                    // PNG files start with 89 50 4E 47 0D 0A 1A 0A\n                    return (header[0] == (byte)0x89 && header[1] == (byte)0x50 && \n                            header[2] == (byte)0x4E && header[3] == (byte)0x47 &&\n                            header[4] == (byte)0x0D && header[5] == (byte)0x0A &&\n                            header[6] == (byte)0x1A && header[7] == (byte)0x0A);\n                    \n                case ".gif":\n                    // GIF files start with "GIF8"\n                    return (header[0] == \'G\' && header[1] == \'I\' && \n                            header[2] == \'F\' && header[3] == \'8\');\n                    \n                case ".bmp":\n                    // BMP files start with "BM"\n                    return (header[0] == \'B\' && header[1] == \'M\');\n                    \n                default:\n                    return true; // For unknown formats, assume valid\n            }\n        } catch (IOException e) {\n            System.err.println("Error reading file signature: " + e.getMessage());\n            return false;\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Quick validation method for basic checks only.\n     * \n     * @param imagePath Path to the image file\n     * @return true if image passes basic validation, false otherwise\n     */\n    public boolean quickValidate(String imagePath) {\n        if (imagePath == null || imagePath.trim().isEmpty()) {\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        File imageFile = new File(imagePath);\n        \n        // Basic checks only\n        if (!imageFile.exists() || !imageFile.canRead()) {\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Check file size\n        long fileSize = imageFile.length();\n        if (fileSize == 0 || fileSize > MAX_FILE_SIZE) {\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Check file extension\n        String fileName = imageFile.getName().toLowerCase();\n        for (String format : SUPPORTED_FORMATS) {\n            if (fileName.endsWith(format)) {\n                return true;\n            }\n        }\n        \n        return false;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Gets the maximum allowed file size in bytes.\n     * \n     * @return maximum file size in bytes\n     */\n    public static long getMaxFileSize() {\n        return MAX_FILE_SIZE;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Gets the maximum allowed file size in MB.\n     * \n     * @return maximum file size in MB\n     */\n    public static double getMaxFileSizeMB() {\n        return MAX_FILE_SIZE / (1024.0 * 1024.0);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Gets the set of supported image formats.\n     * \n     * @return set of supported formats\n     */\n    public static Set<String> getSupportedFormats() {\n        return new HashSet<>(SUPPORTED_FORMATS);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Inner class to represent the result of image validation.\n     * Contains validation status, error messages, and informational messages.\n     */\n    public static class ValidationResult {\n        private boolean isValid;\n        private StringBuilder errors;\n        private StringBuilder warnings;\n        private StringBuilder info;\n        private String dimensions;\n        \n        public ValidationResult() {\n            this.isValid = false;\n            this.errors = new StringBuilder();\n            this.warnings = new StringBuilder();\n            this.info = new StringBuilder();\n            this.dimensions = "";\n        }\n        \n        public boolean isValid() {\n            return isValid;\n        }\n        \n        public void setValid(boolean valid) {\n            this.isValid = valid;\n        }\n        \n        public String getErrors() {\n            return errors.toString();\n        }\n        \n        public void addError(String error) {\n            if (errors.length() > 0) {\n                errors.append("\\n");\n            }\n            errors.append("ERROR: ").append(error);\n        }\n        \n        public String getWarnings() {\n            return warnings.toString();\n        }\n        \n        public void addWarning(String warning) {\n            if (warnings.length() > 0) {\n                warnings.append("\\n");\n            }\n            warnings.append("WARNING: ").append(warning);\n        }\n        \n        public String getInfo() {\n            return info.toString();\n        }\n        \n        public void addInfo(String information) {\n            if (info.length() > 0) {\n                info.append("\\n");\n            }\n            info.append("INFO: ").append(information);\n        }\n        \n        public String getDimensions() {\n            return dimensions;\n        }\n        \n        public void setDimensions(String dimensions) {\n            this.dimensions = dimensions;\n        }\n        \n        /**\n         * Returns a formatted string with all validation messages.\n         * \n         * @return formatted validation report\n         */\n        public String getReport() {\n            StringBuilder report = new StringBuilder();\n            report.append("=== Image Validation Report ===\\n");\n            report.append("Status: ").append(isValid ? "VALID" : "INVALID").append("\\n");\n            \n            if (errors.length() > 0) {\n                report.append("\\nErrors:\\n").append(errors.toString()).append("\\n");\n            }\n            \n            if (warnings.length() > 0) {\n                report.append("\\nWarnings:\\n").append(warnings.toString()).append("\\n");\n            }\n            \n            if (info.length() > 0) {\n                report.append("\\nInformation:\\n").append(info.toString()).append("\\n");\n            }\n            \n            if (!dimensions.isEmpty()) {\n                report.append("\\nDimensions: ").append(dimensions).append("\\n");\n            }\n            \n            report.append("==============================\\n");\n            return report.toString();\n        }\n        \n        @Override\n        public String toString() {\n            return getReport();\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Main method for testing the ImageValidator class.\n     * \n     * @param args Command line arguments (optional image file path)\n     */\n    public static void main(String[] args) {\n        ImageValidator validator = new ImageValidator();\n        \n        if (args.length > 0) {\n            String imagePath = args[0];\n            System.out.println("Validating image: " + imagePath);\n            ValidationResult result = validator.validateImage(imagePath);\n            System.out.println(result.getReport());\n            System.exit(result.isValid() ? 0 : 1);\n        } else {\n            // Demo mode\n            System.out.println("=== ImageValidator Demo ===");\n            System.out.println("Maximum file size: " + getMaxFileSizeMB() + " MB");\n            System.out.println("Supported formats: " + String.join(", ", getSupportedFormats()));\n            System.out.println("Minimum dimensions: " + MIN_WIDTH + "x" + MIN_HEIGHT);\n            System.out.println("Maximum dimensions: " + MAX_WIDTH + "x" + MAX_HEIGHT);\n            \n            // Test with a non-existent file\n            ValidationResult testResult = validator.validateImage("/nonexistent/image.jpg");\n            System.out.println("\\nTest 1 - Non-existent file:");\n            System.out.println(testResult.getReport());\n            \n            // Test quick validation\n            System.out.println("\\nQuick validation test (should be false): " + \n                             validator.quickValidate("/nonexistent/image.jpg"));\n        }\n    }\n}'}, {'role': 'assistant', 'content': 'Perfect! Command Engineer2.write_new_code executed: The file /home///baselines/MetaGPT/workspace/ModifyBannerJava_1766826453/Main.java has been successfully created, with content:
import java.util.*;
import java.io.*;

/**
 * Main class demonstrating the complete ModifyBanner use case.
 * This program creates sample data, initializes an AgencyOperator,
 * and runs the banner modification flow as described in the use case.
 * 
 * The program demonstrates:
 * 1. Creating sample rest points and banners
 * 2. Agency operator login
 * 3. Banner selection and image modification flow
 * 4. Image validation and error handling
 * 5. Successful banner update notification
 */
public class Main {
    
    /**
     * Main method - entry point of the program.
     * Creates sample data and runs the banner modification demonstration.
     * 
     * @param args Command line arguments (not used)
     */
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        System.out.println("=== ModifyBanner Use Case Demonstration ===\n");
        
        // Create sample rest points with banners
        List<RestPoint> restPoints = createSampleRestPoints();
        
        // Create and initialize agency operator
        AgencyOperator operator = new AgencyOperator("OP001", "John Doe");
        
        // Simulate login (Entry condition: The agency has logged)
        System.out.println("=== Entry Condition: Agency Login ===");
        boolean loginSuccess = operator.login("agency", "password123");
        
        if (!loginSuccess) {
            System.out.println("Login failed. Exiting program.");
            return;
        }
        
        // Set available rest points (from SearchRefreshmentPoint use case)
        operator.setAvailableRestPoints(restPoints);
        
        System.out.println("\n=== Starting ModifyBanner Flow ===");
        System.out.println("This demonstrates the complete flow of changing a banner image.\n");
        
        // Execute the banner modification flow
        operator.executeModifyBannerFlow();
        
        // Demonstrate error case with invalid image
        System.out.println("\n\n=== Demonstrating Error Case ===");
        demonstrateErrorCase(operator, restPoints);
        
        // Demonstrate server interruption scenario
        System.out.println("\n\n=== Demonstrating Server Interruption ===");
        demonstrateServerInterruption();
        
        // Show final state of banners
        System.out.println("\n=== Final Banner Status ===");
        displayFinalBannerStatus(restPoints);
        
        // Clean up
        operator.close();
        
        System.out.println("\n=== Program Complete ===");
        System.out.println("The ModifyBanner use case has been successfully demonstrated.");
    }
    
    /**
     * Creates sample rest points with banners for demonstration.
     * 
     * @return List of rest points with sample banners
     */
    private static List<RestPoint> createSampleRestPoints() {
        List<RestPoint> restPoints = new ArrayList<>();
        
        // Create first rest point
        RestPoint cafe = new RestPoint("RP001", "Downtown Cafe", "123 Main Street");
        cafe.addBanner(new Banner("B001", "RP001", "/images/banners/cafe_banner1.jpg"));
        cafe.addBanner(new Banner("B002", "RP001", "/images/banners/cafe_banner2.png"));
        cafe.addBanner(new Banner("B003", "RP001", "/images/banners/cafe_promo.gif"));
        restPoints.add(cafe);
        
        // Create second rest point
        RestPoint mall = new RestPoint("RP002", "City Center Mall", "456 Oak Avenue");
        mall.addBanner(new Banner("B004", "RP002", "/images/banners/mall_ad1.jpg"));
        mall.addBanner(new Banner("B005", "RP002", "/images/banners/mall_ad2.png"));
        restPoints.add(mall);
        
        // Create third rest point
        RestPoint park = new RestPoint("RP003", "Central Park", "789 Pine Road");
        park.addBanner(new Banner("B006", "RP003", "/images/banners/park_event.jpg"));
        restPoints.add(park);
        
        System.out.println("Created " + restPoints.size() + " sample rest points:");
        for (RestPoint point : restPoints) {
            System.out.println("  - " + point.getPointName() + 
                             " (" + point.getBannerCount() + " banners)");
        }
        
        return restPoints;
    }
    
    /**
     * Demonstrates the error case when an invalid image is selected.
     * 
     * @param operator The agency operator
     * @param restPoints List of rest points
     */
    private static void demonstrateErrorCase(AgencyOperator operator, List<RestPoint> restPoints) {
        System.out.println("Simulating error case with invalid image...");
        
        // Create a test operator for error demonstration
        AgencyOperator testOperator = new AgencyOperator("OP002", "Test Operator");
        testOperator.login("agency", "password123");
        
        // Create a test rest point with a single banner
        RestPoint testPoint = new RestPoint("RP999", "Test Location", "Test Address");
        Banner testBanner = new Banner("B999", "RP999", "/images/banners/current.jpg");
        testPoint.addBanner(testBanner);
        
        List<RestPoint> testPoints = new ArrayList<>();
        testPoints.add(testPoint);
        testOperator.setAvailableRestPoints(testPoints);
        
        System.out.println("\nWhen an invalid image is selected (e.g., non-existent file,");
        System.out.println("wrong format, or too large), the system will:");
        System.out.println("1. Detect the invalid image");
        System.out.println("2. Enable the Errored use case");
        System.out.println("3. Preserve the current banner image");
        System.out.println("4. Log the error for monitoring");
        
        // Demonstrate ImageValidator separately
        System.out.println("\n--- ImageValidator Demonstration ---");
        ImageValidator validator = new ImageValidator();
        
        // Test with various invalid cases
        String[] invalidImages = {
            "/nonexistent/image.jpg",           // Non-existent file
            "/etc/passwd",                      // Wrong file type
            "test.txt",                         // Wrong extension
            "/dev/zero"                         // Special file
        };
        
        for (String invalidImage : invalidImages) {
            ImageValidator.ValidationResult result = validator.validateImage(invalidImage);
            System.out.println("\nValidating: " + invalidImage);
            System.out.println("Result: " + (result.isValid() ? "VALID" : "INVALID"));
            if (!result.isValid()) {
                System.out.println("Errors: " + result.getErrors());
            }
        }
        
        testOperator.close();
    }
    
    /**
     * Demonstrates handling of server interruption (ETOUR connection loss).
     */
    private static void demonstrateServerInterruption() {
        System.out.println("Simulating server ETOUR connection interruption...");
        
        System.out.println("\nIn a real scenario, the system would:");
        System.out.println("1. Detect connection loss to server ETOUR");
        System.out.println("2. Display appropriate error message to the user");
        System.out.println("3. Log the interruption for system monitoring");
        System.out.println("4. Allow retry or save state for recovery");
        System.out.println("5. Ensure data integrity is maintained");
        
        System.out.println("\nError handling mechanisms in place:");
        System.out.println("- Transaction rollback for incomplete operations");
        System.out.println("- Automatic reconnection attempts");
        System.out.println("- User notification with recovery options");
        System.out.println("- Error logging to banner_errors.log file");
    }
    
    /**
     * Displays the final status of all banners after demonstration.
     * 
     * @param restPoints List of rest points with banners
     */
    private static void displayFinalBannerStatus(List<RestPoint> restPoints) {
        System.out.println("Current banner status across all rest points:");
        
        int totalBanners = 0;
        int validBanners = 0;
        
        for (RestPoint point : restPoints) {
            System.out.println("\n" + point.getPointName() + " (" + point.getPointId() + "):");
            
            List<Banner> banners = point.getBanners();
            totalBanners += banners.size();
            
            for (Banner banner : banners) {
                boolean isValid = banner.validateImage();
                if (isValid) validBanners++;
                
                System.out.println("  - Banner " + banner.getBannerId() + 
                                 ": " + banner.getImagePath() +
                                 " [" + (isValid ? "VALID" : "INVALID") + "]");
            }
        }
        
        System.out.println("\nSummary:");
        System.out.println("Total banners: " + totalBanners);
        System.out.println("Valid banners: " + validBanners);
        System.out.println("Invalid banners: " + (totalBanners - validBanners));
    }
    
    /**
     * Helper method to create a test file for demonstration purposes.
     * In a real application, this would be an actual image file.
     * 
     * @param filePath Path where to create the test file
     * @param sizeInKB Size of the test file in KB
     * @return true if file was created successfully, false otherwise
     */
    private static boolean createTestFile(String filePath, int sizeInKB) {
        try {
            File testFile = new File(filePath);
            testFile.getParentFile().mkdirs();
            
            byte[] data = new byte[1024]; // 1KB chunks
            Arrays.fill(data, (byte) 'X');
            
            try (FileOutputStream fos = new FileOutputStream(testFile)) {
                for (int i = 0; i < sizeInKB; i++) {
                    fos.write(data);
                }
            }
            
            // Rename to have proper extension for testing
            File renamedFile = new File(filePath + ".jpg");
            testFile.renameTo(renamedFile);
            
            return true;
        } catch (IOException e) {
            System.err.println("Failed to create test file: " + e.getMessage());
            return false;
        }
    }
    
    /**
     * Demonstrates the complete successful flow with a simulated image update.
     * This method shows what happens when a valid image is selected.
     */
    private static void demonstrateSuccessfulFlow() {
        System.out.println("\n=== Successful Flow Demonstration ===");
        
        // Create a sample banner
        Banner demoBanner = new Banner("DEMO001", "DEMORP", "/images/demo/current_banner.jpg");
        
        System.out.println("Initial banner state:");
        System.out.println("  ID: " + demoBanner.getBannerId());
        System.out.println("  Current image: " + demoBanner.getImagePath());
        System.out.println("  Created: " + demoBanner.getCreatedAt());
        
        // Simulate successful image update
        String newImagePath = "/images/demo/new_banner.jpg";
        System.out.println("\nUpdating to new image: " + newImagePath);
        
        boolean success = demoBanner.updateImage(newImagePath);
        
        if (success) {
            System.out.println("\nUpdate successful!");
            System.out.println("  New image: " + demoBanner.getImagePath());
            System.out.println("  Updated at: " + demoBanner.getUpdatedAt());
            System.out.println("  Image valid: " + demoBanner.validateImage());
            
            // Exit condition: Notify successful modification
            System.out.println("\n=== Exit Condition Met ===");
            System.out.println("The system has successfully modified the banner.");
            System.out.println("Notification sent: Banner " + demoBanner.getBannerId() + 
                             " updated successfully.");
        } else {
            System.out.println("\nUpdate failed. Image may be invalid.");
        }
    }
}

limit\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Check file extension for common image formats\n        String fileName = imageFile.getName().toLowerCase();\n        return /home///baselines/MetaGPT/workspace/ModifyBannerJava_1766826453/RestPoint.java has been successfully created, with content:\nimport java.util.*;\nimport java.util.stream.Collectors;\n\n/**\n * Represents a refreshment point (rest point) with associated banners.\n * This class manages the collection of banners at a specific location.\n */\npublic class RestPoint {\n    private String pointId;\n    private String pointName;\n    private String location;\n    private List<Banner> banners;\n    private Date createdAt;\n    \n    /**\n     * Constructor for creating a new refreshment point.\n     * @param pointId Unique identifier for the refreshment point\n     * @param pointName Name of the refreshment point\n     * @param location Physical location description\n     */\n    public RestPoint(String pointId, String pointName, String location) {\n        this.pointId = pointId;\n        this.pointName = pointName;\n        this.location = location;\n        this.banners = new ArrayList<>();\n        this.createdAt = new Date();\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Adds a banner to this refreshment point.\n     * @param banner The banner to add\n     * @return true if banner was added successfully, false if banner already exists\n     */\n    public boolean addBanner(Banner banner) {\n        if (banner == null) {\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Check if banner with same ID already exists\n        boolean exists = banners.stream()\n            .anyMatch(b -> b.getBannerId().equals(banner.getBannerId()));\n        \n        if (!exists) {\n            banners.add(banner);\n            return true;\n        }\n        \n        return false;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Removes a banner from this refreshment point.\n     * @param bannerId ID of the banner to remove\n     * @return true if banner was removed, false if banner not found\n     */\n    public boolean removeBanner(String bannerId) {\n        if (bannerId == null) {\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        return banners.removeIf(banner -> banner.getBannerId().equals(bannerId));\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Gets a banner by its ID.\n     * @param bannerId ID of the banner to retrieve\n     * @return the Banner object, or null if not found\n     */\n    public Banner getBanner(String bannerId) {\n        if (bannerId == null) {\n            return null;\n        }\n        \n        return banners.stream()\n            .filter(banner -> banner.getBannerId().equals(bannerId))\n            .findFirst()\n            .orElse(null);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Gets all banners associated with this refreshment point.\n     * @return list of banners (unmodifiable)\n     */\n    public List<Banner> getBanners() {\n        return {\n        return banners.size();\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Gets banners that have valid images.\n     * @return list of banners with valid images\n     */\n    public List<Banner> getValidBanners() {\n        return banners.stream()\n            .filter(Banner::validateImage)\n            .collect(Collectors.toList());\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Updates a banner image at this refreshment point.\n     * @param bannerId ID of the banner to update\n     * @param newImagePath Path to the new image file\n     * @return true if update was successful, false otherwise\n     */\n    public boolean updateBannerImage(String bannerId, String newImagePath) {\n        Banner banner = getBanner(bannerId);\n        if (banner == null) {\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        return banner.updateImage(newImagePath);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Validates all banners at this refreshment point.\n     * @return list of banners with invalid images\n     */\n    public List<Banner> validateAllBanners() {\n        List<Banner> invalidBanners = new ArrayList<>();\n        \n        for (Banner banner : banners) {\n            if (!banner.validateImage()) {\n                invalidBanners.add(banner);\n            }\n        }\n        \n        return invalidBanners;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Gets the point ID.\n     * @return point ID\n     */\n                \'}\';\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Creates a summary of all banners at this point.\n     * @return formatted string with banner details\n     */\n    public String getBannersSummary() Welcome, " + operatorName + "!");\n            return true;\n        }\n        this.isLoggedIn = false;\n        System.out.println("Login failed. Invalid credentials.");\n        return false;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Logs out the agency operator.\n     */\n    public void logout() {\n        this.isLoggedIn = false;\n        System.out.println("Logged out successfully.");\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Checks if operator is logged in.\n     * @return true if logged in, false otherwise\n     */\n    public boolean isLoggedIn() {\n        return isLoggedIn;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Sets the list of available rest points (from SearchRefreshmentPoint use case).\n     * @param restPoints List of rest points\n     */\n    public void setAvailableRestPoints(List<RestPoint> restPoints) {\n        if (restPoints != null) {\n            this.availableRestPoints = new ArrayList<>(restPoints);\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Displays the list of available rest points.\n     */\n    public void displayRestPoints() {\n        if (availableRestPoints.isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("No rest points available.");\n            return;\n        }\n        \n        System.out.println("\\n=== Available Rest Points ===");\n        for (int i = 0; i < availableRestPoints.size(); i++) {\n            RestPoint point = availableRestPoints.get(i);\n            System.out.println((i + 1) + ". " + point.getPointName() + \n                             " (ID: " + point.getPointId() + \n                             ", Location: " + point.getLocation() + \n                             ", Banners: " + point.getBannerCount() + ")");\n        }\n        System.out.println("=============================\\n");\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Main method to execute the banner modification flow.\n     * This implements the complete use case flow.\n     */\n    public void executeModifyBannerFlow() {\n        if (!isLoggedIn) {\n            System.out.println("Error: Operator must be logged in to modify banners.");\n            return;\n        }\n        \n        try {\n            // Step 1: Receive list of rest points and select one\n            System.out.println("\\n=== Step 1: Select a Rest Point ===");\n            displayRestPoints();\n            \n            if (availableRestPoints.isEmpty()) {\n                System.out.println("No rest points available. Exiting flow.");\n                return;\n            }\n            \n            System.out.print("Enter the number of the rest point to select: ");\n            int pointChoice = Integer.parseInt(scanner.nextLine()) - 1;\n            \n            if (pointChoice < 0 || pointChoice >= availableRestPoints.size()) {\n                System.out.println("Invalid selection. Exiting flow.");\n                return;\n            }\n            \n            RestPoint selectedPoint = availableRestPoints.get(pointChoice);\n            System.out.println("Selected: " + selectedPoint.getPointName());\n            \n            // Step 2: View list of banners associated with the selected rest point\n            System.out.println("\\n=== Step 2: Banners at Selected Rest Point ===");\n            List<Banner> banners = selectedPoint.getBanners();\n            \n            if (banners.isEmpty()) {\n                System.out.println("No banners available at this rest point. Exiting flow.");\n                return;\n            }\n            \n            for (int i = 0; i < banners.size(); i++) {\n                Banner banner = banners.get(i);\n                System.out.println((i + 1) + ". Banner ID: " + banner.getBannerId() + \n                                 ", Image: " + banner.getImagePath() + \n                                 ", Status: " + (banner.validateImage() ? "Valid" : "Invalid"));\n            }\n            \n            // Step 3: Select a banner from the list\n            System.out.println("\\n=== Step 3: Select a Banner to Edit ===");\n            System.out.print("Enter the number of the banner to edit: ");\n            int bannerChoice = Integer.parseInt(scanner.nextLine()) - 1;\n            \n            if (bannerChoice < 0 || bannerChoice >= banners.size()) {\n                System.out.println("Invalid banner selection. Exiting flow.");\n                return;\n            }\n            \n            Banner selectedBanner = banners.get(bannerChoice);\n            System.out.println("Selected Banner: " + selectedBanner.getBannerId());\n            \n            // Step 4: Display form for image selection\n            System.out.println("\\n=== Step 4: Image Selection Form ===");\n            System.out.println("Current image: " + selectedBanner.getImagePath());\n            System.out.print("Enter the path to the new image file: ");\n            String newImagePath = scanner.nextLine().trim();\n            \n            // Step 5: Send request to change the system\n            System.out.println("\\n=== Step 5: Processing Image Change Request ===");\n            \n            // Step 6: Check characteristics of the inserted image\n            System.out.println("\\n=== Step 6: Image Validation ===");\n            boolean isValid = validateImageForBanner(newImagePath);\n            \n            if (!isValid) {\n                System.out.println("ERROR: The inserted image is not valid.");\n                System.out.println("Enabling use case Errored...");\n                handleErrorCase(selectedBanner, newImagePath);\n                return;\n            }\n            \n            // Ask for confirmation\n            System.out.println("\\nImage validation successful!");\n            System.out.println("New image path: " + newImagePath);\n            System.out.print("Confirm banner change? (yes/no): ");\n            String confirmation = scanner.nextLine().trim().toLowerCase();\n            \n            // Step 7: Confirmation of transaction change\n            if (confirmation.equals("yes") || confirmation.equals("y")) {\n                System.out.println("\\n=== Step 7: Confirming Transaction ===");\n                \n                // Step 8: Bookmark the new image for the selected banner\n                System.out.println("\\n=== Step 8: Updating Banner Image ===");\n                boolean updateSuccess = selectedBanner.updateImage(newImagePath);\n                \n                if (updateSuccess) {\n                    System.out.println("SUCCESS: Banner image has been updated successfully!");\n                    System.out.println("Banner ID: " + selectedBanner.getBannerId());\n                    System.out.println("New Image: " + selectedBanner.getImagePath());\n                    System.out.println("Updated at: " + selectedBanner.getUpdatedAt());\n                    \n                    // Exit condition: Notify successful modification\n                    System.out.println("\\n=== Exit Condition: Successful Modification ===");\n                    System.out.println("The system has successfully modified the banner.");\n                } else {\n                    System.out.println("ERROR: Failed to update banner image.");\n                    handleErrorCase(selectedBanner, newImagePath);\n                }\n            } else {\n                System.out.println("Transaction cancelled by user.");\n            }\n            \n        } catch (NumberFormatException e) {\n            System.out.println("Invalid input. Please enter a valid number.");\n        } catch (Exception e) {\n            System.out.println("An unexpected error occurred: " + e.getMessage());\n            handleServerInterruption();\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Validates an image file for banner use.\n     * @param imagePath Path to the image file\n     * @return true if image is valid, false otherwise\n     */\n    private boolean validateImageForBanner(String imagePath) {\n        if (imagePath == null || imagePath.trim().isEmpty()) {\n            System.out.println("Error: Image path cannot be empty.");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        File imageFile = new File(imagePath);\n        \n        // Check if file exists\n        if (!imageFile.exists()) {\n            System.out.println("Error: Image file does not exist: " + imagePath);\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Check if file is readable\n        if (!imageFile.canRead()) {\n            System.out.println("Error: Cannot read image file: " + imagePath);\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Check file size (max 5MB for banner images)\n        long fileSize = imageFile.length();\n        long maxSize = 5 * 1024 * 1024; // 5MB\n        if (fileSize > maxSize) {\n            System.out.println("Error: Image file is too large. Maximum size is 5MB.");\n            System.out.println("Current size: " + (fileSize / 1024) + "KB");\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Check file extension\n        String fileName = imageFile.getName().toLowerCase();\n        String[] validExtensions = {".jpg", ".jpeg", ".png", ".gif", ".bmp"};\n        \n        for (String ext : validExtensions) {\n            if (fileName.endsWith(ext)) {\n                System.out.println("Image validation passed: " + fileName);\n                System.out.println("File size: " + (fileSize / 1024) + "KB");\n                return true;\n            }\n        }\n        \n        System.out.println("Error: Invalid image format. Supported formats: JPG, JPEG, PNG, GIF, BMP");\n        return false;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Handles error case when image validation fails.\n     * @param banner The banner being modified\n     * @param invalidImagePath The invalid image path\n     */\n    private void handleErrorCase(Banner banner, String invalidImagePath) {\n        System.out.println("\\n=== Error Case Handler ===");\n        System.out.println("Banner ID: " + banner.getBannerId());\n        System.out.println("Invalid image path: " + invalidImagePath);\n        System.out.println("Current image preserved: " + banner.getImagePath());\n        System.out.println("Please try again with a valid image file.");\n        \n        // Log the error for monitoring\n        logError("Image validation failed for banner " + banner.getBannerId() + \n                ", invalid path: " + invalidImagePath);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Handles server interruption (ETOUR connection loss).\n     */\n    private void handleServerInterruption() {\n        System.out.println("\\n=== Server Interruption Handler ===");\n        System.out.println("ERROR: Connection to server ETOUR has been interrupted.");\n        System.out.println("Please check your network connection and try again.");\n        System.out.println("Any pending transactions may need to be restarted.");\n        \n        // Log the interruption\n        logError("Server ETOUR connection interrupted at " + new Date());\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Logs error messages to a file.\n     * @param errorMessage The error message to log\n     */\n    private void logError(String errorMessage) {\n        try (PrintWriter writer = new PrintWriter(new FileWriter("banner_errors.log", true))) {\n            writer.println(new Date() + " - " + errorMessage);\n        } catch (IOException e) {\n            System.err.println("Failed to write to error log: " + e.getMessage());\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Gets the operator ID.\n     * @return operator ID\n     */\n    public String getOperatorId() {\n        return operatorId;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Gets the operator name.\n     * @return operator name\n     */\n    public String getOperatorName() {\n        return operatorName;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Gets the list of available rest points.\n     * @return list of rest points\n     */\n    public List<RestPoint> getAvailableRestPoints() {\n        return Collections.unmodifiableList(availableRestPoints);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Adds a rest point to available list.\n     * @param restPoint Rest point to add\n     */\n    public void addRestPoint(RestPoint restPoint) {\n        if (restPoint != null) {\n            availableRestPoints.add(restPoint);\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Removes a rest point from available list.\n     * @param pointId ID of the rest point to remove\n     * @return true if removed, false if not found\n     */\n    public boolean removeRestPoint(String pointId) {\n        return availableRestPoints.removeIf(point -> point.getPointId().equals(pointId));\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Clears the scanner resource.\n     * Should be called when the operator is no longer needed.\n     */\n    public void close() {\n        if (scanner != null) {\n            scanner.close();\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Simulates a test run of the modify banner flow with sample data.\n     * This is for demonstration purposes.\n     */\n    public void testModifyBannerFlow() {\n        System.out.println("\\n=== Starting Test Modify Banner Flow ===");\n        \n        // Create sample rest points and banners\n        RestPoint testPoint = new RestPoint("RP001", "Downtown Cafe", "123 Main St");\n        Banner testBanner1 = new Banner("B001", "RP001", "/images/banner1.jpg");\n        Banner testBanner2 = new Banner("B002", "RP001", "/images/banner2.png");\n        \n        testPoint.addBanner(testBanner1);\n        testPoint.addBanner(testBanner2);\n        \n        List<RestPoint> testPoints = new ArrayList<>();\n        testPoints.add(testPoint);\n        \n        setAvailableRestPoints(testPoints);\n /home///baselines/MetaGPT/workspace/ModifyBannerJava_1766826453/ImageValidator.java has been successfully created, with content:\nimport java.io.File;\nimport java.io.IOException;\nimport java.nio.file.Files;\nimport java.nio.file.Path;\nimport java.nio.file.Paths;\nimport java.util.Arrays;\nimport java.util.HashSet;\nimport java.util.Set;\n\n/**\n * A comprehensive image validator for banner advertisement images.\n * This class performs various checks to ensure image files meet the required standards.\n */\npublic class ImageValidator {\n    \n    // Supported image formats\n    private static final Set<String> SUPPORTED_FORMATS = new HashSet<>(Arrays.asList(\n        ".jpg", ".jpeg", ".png", ".gif", ".bmp"\n    ));\n    \n    // Maximum file size for banner images (5MB)\n    private static final long MAX_FILE_SIZE = 5 * 1024 * 1024;\n    \n    // Minimum dimensions for banner images\n    private static final int MIN_WIDTH = 300;\n    private static final int MIN_HEIGHT = 150;\n    \n    // Maximum dimensions for banner images\n    private static final int MAX_WIDTH = 1920;\n    private static final int MAX_HEIGHT = 1080;\n    \n    /**\n     * Validates an image file for use as a banner.\n     * Performs comprehensive checks including format, size, and basic file validation.\n     * \n     * @param imagePath Path to the image file\n     * @return ValidationResult object containing validation status and messages\n     */\n    public ValidationResult validateImage(String imagePath) {\n        ValidationResult result = new ValidationResult();\n        \n        if (imagePath == null || imagePath.trim().isEmpty()) {\n            result.addError("Image path cannot be null or empty");\n            return result;\n        }\n        \n        File imageFile = new File(imagePath);\n        \n        // Check file existence and accessibility\n        if (!imageFile.exists()) {\n            result.addError("Image file does not exist: " + imagePath);\n            return result;\n        }\n        \n        if (!imageFile.canRead()) {\n            result.addError("Cannot read image file. Check file permissions: " + imagePath);\n            return result;\n        }\n        \n        if (!imageFile.isFile()) {\n            result.addError("Path is not a file: " + imagePath);\n            return result;\n        }\n        \n        // Check file size\n        long fileSize = imageFile.length();\n        if (fileSize == 0) {\n            result.addError("Image file is empty (0 bytes)");\n            return result;\n        }\n        \n        if (fileSize > MAX_FILE_SIZE) {\n            result.addError("Image file is too large. Maximum size: " + \n                          (MAX_FILE_SIZE / (1024 * 1024)) + "MB. " +\n                          "Current size: " + String.format("%.2f", fileSize / (1024.0 * 1024.0)) + "MB");\n            return result;\n        }\n        \n        // Check file extension\n        String fileName = imageFile.getName().toLowerCase();\n        boolean validExtension = false;\n        String fileExtension = "";\n        \n        for (String format : SUPPORTED_FORMATS) {\n            if (fileName.endsWith(format)) {\n                validExtension = true;\n                fileExtension = format;\n                break;\n            }\n        }\n        \n        if (!validExtension) {\n            result.addError("Unsupported image format. Supported formats: " + \n                          String.join(", ", SUPPORTED_FORMATS));\n            return result;\n        }\n        \n        // Check file header/magic numbers for basic format validation\n        if (!validateFileSignature(imageFile, fileExtension)) {\n            result.addError("File signature does not match the expected format for " + fileExtension);\n            return result;\n        }\n        \n        // Check image dimensions if possible\n        try {\n            // Note: In a real implementation, you would use an image library like ImageIO\n            // to read dimensions. For this example, we\'ll simulate it.\n            // String dimensions = getImageDimensions(imageFile);\n            // result.setDimensions(dimensions);\n            \n            // For demonstration, we\'ll add a success message about dimensions\n            result.addInfo("Image dimensions check would be performed here with an image library");\n        } catch (Exception e) {\n            result.addWarning("Could not read image dimensions: " + e.getMessage());\n        }\n        \n        // All checks passed\n        result.setValid(true);\n        result.addInfo("Image validation successful");\n        result.addInfo("File: " + fileName);\n        result.addInfo("Size: " + String.format("%.2f", fileSize / 1024.0) + "KB");\n        result.addInfo("Format: " + fileExtension.substring(1).toUpperCase());\n        \n        return result;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Validates file signature (magic numbers) to ensure file format matches its extension.\n     * \n     * @param file The image file to validate\n     * @param extension The expected file extension\n     * @return true if file signature matches the extension, false otherwise\n     */\n    private boolean validateFileSignature(File file, String extension) {\n        try {\n            byte[] header = new byte[8];\n            Path path = Paths.get(file.getAbsolutePath());\n            byte[] fileBytes = Files.readAllBytes(path);\n            \n            if (fileBytes.length < 8) {\n                return false;\n            }\n            \n            System.arraycopy(fileBytes, 0, header, 0, 8);\n            \n            // Check for common image file signatures\n            switch (extension) {\n                case ".jpg":\n                case ".jpeg":\n                    // JPEG files start with FF D8 FF\n                    return (header[0] == (byte)0xFF && header[1] == (byte)0xD8 && \n                            header[2] == (byte)0xFF);\n                    \n                case ".png":\n                    // PNG files start with 89 50 4E 47 0D 0A 1A 0A\n                    return (header[0] == (byte)0x89 && header[1] == (byte)0x50 && \n                            header[2] == (byte)0x4E && header[3] == (byte)0x47 &&\n                            header[4] == (byte)0x0D && header[5] == (byte)0x0A &&\n                            header[6] == (byte)0x1A && header[7] == (byte)0x0A);\n                    \n                case ".gif":\n                    // GIF files start with "GIF8"\n                    return (header[0] == \'G\' && header[1] == \'I\' && \n                            header[2] == \'F\' && header[3] == \'8\');\n                    \n                case ".bmp":\n                    // BMP files start with "BM"\n                    return (header[0] == \'B\' && header[1] == \'M\');\n                    \n                default:\n                    return true; // For unknown formats, assume valid\n            }\n        } catch (IOException e) {\n            System.err.println("Error reading file signature: " + e.getMessage());\n            return false;\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Quick validation method for basic checks only.\n     * \n     * @param imagePath Path to the image file\n     * @return true if image passes basic validation, false otherwise\n     */\n    public boolean quickValidate(String imagePath) {\n        if (imagePath == null || imagePath.trim().isEmpty()) {\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        File imageFile = new File(imagePath);\n        \n        // Basic checks only\n        if (!imageFile.exists() || !imageFile.canRead()) {\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Check file size\n        long fileSize = imageFile.length();\n        if (fileSize == 0 || fileSize > MAX_FILE_SIZE) {\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Check file extension\n        String fileName = imageFile.getName().toLowerCase();\n        for (String format : SUPPORTED_FORMATS) {\n            if (fileName.endsWith(format)) {\n                return true;\n            }\n        }\n        \n        return false;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Gets the maximum allowed file size in bytes.\n     * \n     * @return maximum file size in bytes\n     */\n    public static long getMaxFileSize() {\n        return MAX_FILE_SIZE;\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Gets the maximum allowed file size in MB.\n     * \n     * @return maximum file size in MB\n     */\n    public static double getMaxFileSizeMB() {\n        return MAX_FILE_SIZE / (1024.0 * 1024.0);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Gets the set of supported image formats.\n     * \n     * @return set of supported formats\n     */\n    public static Set<String> getSupportedFormats() {\n        return new HashSet<>(SUPPORTED_FORMATS);\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Inner class to represent the result of image validation.\n     * Contains validation status, error messages, and informational messages.\n     */\n    public static class ValidationResult {\n        private boolean isValid;\n        private StringBuilder errors;\n        private StringBuilder warnings;\n        private StringBuilder info;\n        private String dimensions;\n        \n        public ValidationResult() {\n            this.isValid = false;\n            this.errors = new StringBuilder();\n            this.warnings = new StringBuilder();\n            this.info = new StringBuilder();\n            this.dimensions = "";\n        }\n        \n        public boolean isValid() {\n            return isValid;\n        }\n        \n        public void setValid(boolean valid) {\n            this.isValid = valid;\n        }\n        \n        public String getErrors() {\n            return errors.toString();\n        }\n        \n        public void addError(String error) {\n            if (errors.length() > 0) {\n                errors.append("\\n");\n            }\n            errors.append("ERROR: ").append(error);\n        }\n        \n        public String getWarnings() {\n            return warnings.toString();\n        }\n        \n        public void addWarning(String warning) {\n            if (warnings.length() > 0) {\n                warnings.append("\\n");\n            }\n            warnings.append("WARNING: ").append(warning);\n        }\n        \n        public String getInfo() {\n            return info.toString();\n        }\n        \n        public void addInfo(String information) {\n            if (info.length() > 0) {\n                info.append("\\n");\n            }\n            info.append("INFO: ").append(information);\n        }\n        \n        public String getDimensions() {\n            return dimensions;\n        }\n        \n        public void setDimensions(String dimensions) {\n            this.dimensions = dimensions;\n        }\n        \n        /**\n         * Returns a formatted string with all validation messages.\n         * \n         * @return formatted validation report\n         */\n        public String getReport() {\n            StringBuilder report = new StringBuilder();\n            report.append("=== Image Validation Report ===\\n");\n            report.append("Status: ").append(isValid ? "VALID" : "INVALID").append("\\n");\n            \n            if (errors.length() > 0) {\n                report.append("\\nErrors:\\n").append(errors.toString()).append("\\n");\n            }\n            \n            if (warnings.length() > 0) {\n                report.append("\\nWarnings:\\n").append(warnings.toString()).append("\\n");\n            }\n            \n            if (info.length() > 0) {\n                report.append("\\nInformation:\\n").append(info.toString()).append("\\n");\n            }\n            \n            if (!dimensions.isEmpty()) {\n                report.append("\\nDimensions: ").append(dimensions).append("\\n");\n            }\n            \n            report.append("==============================\\n");\n            return report.toString();\n        }\n        \n        @Override\n        public String toString() {\n            return getReport();\n        }\n    }\n    \n    /**\n     * Main method for testing the ImageValidator class.\n     * \n     * @param args Command line arguments (optional image file path)\n     */\n    public static void main(String[] args) {\n        ImageValidator validator = new ImageValidator();\n        \n        if (args.length > 0) {\n            String imagePath = args[0];\n            System.out.println("Validating image: " + imagePath);\n            ValidationResult result = validator.validateImage(imagePath);\n            System.out.println(result.getReport());\n            System.exit(result.isValid() ? 0 : 1);\n        } else {\n            // Demo mode\n            System.out.println("=== ImageValidator Demo ===");\n            System.out.println("Maximum file size: " + getMaxFileSizeMB() + " MB");\n            System.out.println("Supported formats: " + String.join(", ", getSupportedFormats()));\n            System.out.println("Minimum dimensions: " + MIN_WIDTH + "x" + MIN_HEIGHT);\n            System.out.println("Maximum dimensions: " + MAX_WIDTH + "x" + MAX_HEIGHT);\n            \n            // Test with a non-existent file\n            ValidationResult testResult = validator.validateImage("/nonexistent/image.jpg");\n            System.out.println("\\nTest 1 - Non-existent file:");\n            System.out.println(testResult.getReport());\n            \n            // Test quick validation\n            System.out.println("\\nQuick validation test (should be false): " + \n                             validator.quickValidate("/nonexistent/image.jpg"));\n        }\n    }\n}'}, {'role': 'assistant', 'content': 'Perfect! an existing plan to achieve the goal. A plan consists of one to 3 tasks.\nIf plan is created, you should track the progress and update the plan accordingly, such as Plan.finish_current_task, Plan.append_task, Plan.reset_task, Plan.replace_task, etc.\nWhen presented a current task, tackle the task using the available commands.\nPay close attention to new user message, review the conversation history, use RoleZero.reply_to_human to respond to new user requirement.\nNote:\n1. If you keeping encountering errors, unexpected situation, or you are not sure of proceeding, use RoleZero.ask_human to ask for help.\n2. Carefully review your progress at the current task, if your actions so far has not fulfilled the task instruction, you should continue with current task. Otherwise, finish current task by Plan.finish_current_task explicitly.\n3. Each time you finish a task, use RoleZero.reply_to_human to report your progress.\n4. Don\'t forget to append task first when all existing tasks are finished and new tasks are required.\n5. Avoid repeating tasks you have already completed. And end loop when all requirements are met.\nYou are an autonomous programmer\n\nThe special interface consists of a file editor that shows you 100 lines of a file at a time.\n\nYou can use terminal commands (e.g., cat, ls, cd) by calling Terminal.run_command.\n\nYou should carefully observe the behavior and results of the previous action, and avoid triggering repeated errors.\n\nIn addition to the terminal, I also provide additional tools. \n\nIf provided an issue link, you first action must be navigate to the issue page using Browser tool to understand the issue.\n\nYour must check if the repository exists at the current path. If it exists, navigate to the repository path. If the repository doesn\'t exist, please download it and then navigate to it.\nAll subsequent actions must be performed within this repository path. Do not leave this directory to execute any actions at any time.\n\nNote:\n\n1. If you open a file and need to get to an area around a specific line that is not in the first 100 lines, say line 583, don\'t just use the scroll_down command multiple times. Instead, use the Editor.goto_line command. It\'s much quicker. \n2. Always make sure to look at the currently open file and the current working directory (which appears right after the currently open file). The currently open file might be in a different directory than the working directory! Note that some commands, such as \'create\', open files, so they might change the current open file.\n3. When using Editor.edit_file_by_replace, if there is no exact match, take the difference in indentation into consideration.\n4. After editing, verify the changes to ensure correct line numbers and proper indentation. Adhere to PEP8 standards for Python code.\n5. NOTE ABOUT THE EDIT COMMAND: Indentation really matters! When editing a file, make sure to insert appropriate indentation before each line! Ensuring the code adheres to PEP8 standards. If a edit command fails, you can try to edit the file again to correct the indentation, but don\'t repeat the same command without changes.\n6. To avoid syntax errors when editing files multiple times, consider opening the file to view the surrounding code related to the error line and make modifications based on this context.\n7. Ensure to observe the currently open file and the current working directory, which is displayed right after the open file. The open file might be in a different directory than the working directory. Remember, commands like \'create\' open files and might alter the current open file.\n8. Effectively using Use search commands (`search_dir`, `search_file`, `find_file`) and navigation commands (`open_file`, `goto_line`) to locate and modify files efficiently. The Editor tool can fully satisfy the requirements. Follow these steps and considerations for optimal results:\n\n9. When the edit fails, try to enlarge the range of code.\n10. You must use the Editor.open_file command to open a file before using the Editor tool\'s edit command to modify it. When you open a file, any currently open file will be automatically closed.\n11. Remember, when you use Editor.insert_content_at_line or Editor.edit_file_by_replace, the line numbers will change after the operation. Therefore, if there are multiple operations, perform only the first operation in the current response, and defer the subsequent operations to the next turn.\n11.1 Do not use Editor.insert_content_at_line or Editor.edit_file_by_replace more than once per command list.\n12. If you choose Editor.insert_content_at_line, you must ensure that there is no duplication between the inserted content and the original code. If there is overlap between the new code and the original code, use Editor.edit_file_by_replace instead.\n13. If you choose Editor.edit_file_by_replace, the original code that needs to be replaced must start at the beginning of the line and end at the end of the line\n14. When not specified, you should write files in a folder named "{project_name}_1766826453". The project name is the name of the project which meets the user\'s requirements.\n15. When provided system design or project schedule, you MUST read them first before making a plan, then adhere to them in your implementation, especially in the programming language, package, or framework. You MUST implement all code files prescribed in the system design or project schedule.\n16. When planning, initially list the files for coding, then outline all coding tasks based on the file organization in your first response.\n17. If you plan to read a file, do not include other plans in the same response.\n18. Write only one code file each time and provide its full implementation.\n19. extension.\n     * @return true if image is valid, false otherwise\n     */\n    public boolean validateImage() {\n        if (imagePath == null || imagePath.trim().isEmpty()) {\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        File imageFile = new File(imagePath);\n        \n        // Check if file exists and is readable\n        if (!imageFile.exists() || !imageFile.canRead()) {\n limit\n            return false;\n        }\n        \n        // Check file extension for common image formats\n        String fileName = imageFile.getName().toLowerCase();\n        return }\n        \n        String oldImagePath = this.imagePath;\n        this.imagePath = newImagePath;\n        \n        // Validate the new image\n        if (!validateImage()) {\n            // Revert
